Dayly Ramblings 25.Aug.25
There is a functor-homology description of $\Bbb{E}_n$-homology developed extensively by Fresse, Fresse-Ziegenhagen, Ziegenhagen and Livernet-Richter. It is based on a category $\mathsf{Epi}_n$, which should be related to the operator category of Batanin's pruned n-trees. Can we recover the (multi)complex defined by Livernet-Richter via the morphism of operator categories $\Bbb{O}^{\times n} \rightarrow \Bbb{O}^{\wr n}$?
26.Aug.25
In Fresse it is shown that the dg-enhancement of the category $\mathsf{Epi}_n$ is Koszul. Explicitly this means the following: Considering dg-categories as monoid allows for a Bar-Cobar adjunction between dg-categories and dg-cocategories. Fresse uses this general framework to prove that an ad-hoc defined Koszul-dual dg-category of $\mathsf{Epi}_n$ is in fact a minimal model in the sense that it arises from a quasi-isomorphic sub-dg-cocategory of the Bar-construction. Livernet shows a similar statement for a category of trees, which is used to define operads themselves. It is plausible that there is a general framework of Koszul-categories, which is closed under wreath products and the plus construction, streamlining the proofs of Fresse and Livernet...
